newsitem.title: FINLAND: LEMMINKAINEN SURGES AFTER PROFIT FORECAST.
newsitem.headline: LEMMINKAINEN SURGES AFTER PROFIT FORECAST.

text.p: Shares in Finnish construction group Lemminkainen surged on Thursday after the company said it expected 1996 pre-tax profit to exceed 70 million markka and so beat its own earlier full-year earnings forecast, brokers said.
At 1110/0910 GMT Lemminkainen was traded at 43.50 markka, up 3.90 or almost 10 percent, in thin 380,000 markka volume.
On August 30, reporting first-half figures, the company said it did not expect full-year 1996 pre-tax profit to exceed the previous year's 57.7 million markka.
